from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import sys
import os

from validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from .autoval_exceptions import TestError

sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "..", "..", ".."))
sys.path.append(
    os.path.
    join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "..", "\
        ..", "..", "..")
)
sys.path.append(os.path.join(
    os.path.dirname(__file__),
    "..",
    "..",
    "..",
))



[docs]class ServerUtils:


[docs]    @staticmethod
    def read_cpu_msr(register_to_read):
        '''
        This method is used to for reading CPU machine specific registers (MSR)
        '''
        try:
            value = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
                "rdmsr -a %s --c-language" % register_to_read
            )
            return(value.splitlines()[0])

        except Exception as e:
            raise TestError("Failed to get msr: [%s]" % (e))



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def write_cpu_msr(value, register_to_write):
        '''
        This method is used to for writing CPU machine specific registers (MSR)
        '''
        try:
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
                "wrmsr -a %s %s" % (register_to_write, value)
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise TestError("Failed to write msr: [%s]" % (e))



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def enable_turbo_mode(register_number):
        value = ServerUtils.read_cpu_msr(register_number)
        # capture value and mask MSB BTYE
        value = hex(int(value, 16) & int("0XFFFFFF", 16))
        ServerUtils.write_cpu_msr(value, register_number)
        new_value = ServerUtils.read_cpu_msr(register_number)
        if new_value == value:
            return True
        else:
            return False
